results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 10
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around a train journey to another country and ends with sequences dealing with infinitives.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 05
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around receiving visitors at home and the time, the calendar and seasons of the year. Demonstrative pronouns and adjectives are dealt with in this lesson.

results.title: Frames of reference
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services Incorporated Film Division
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the changes in observed motion of a freely falling body viewed from differently moving frames of reference. Donald Ivey and Patterson Hume discuss relative motion, accelerated and inertial frames of reference, and show the inadequacy of Newtonian physics, calling for calculation of fictitious forces to describe relative motions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Leacock, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services Incorporated Film Division
